title: why are they taking a huge dump on azir!?

embed.description: ( With the release of patch 6.9 to live on May 4th, we started the new 6.10 PBE cycle. ) Previous PBE Cycles in 2016 Below you will find a comprehensive list of new content, balance changes, and whatever else is included in the current PBE cycle!

body:
Arise! (W) can no longer be used on towers to deal 60-230 (+.4 AP).

Emperor's Divide (R):
Wall duration lowered to 3 seconds from 5/6/7
No longer grants 20% movement speed for 1 second when passing through wall for Azir and Allies

Stinger
Total Price reduced to 1100 from 1200
Attack speed lowered to 35% from 50%
Now Builds into Trinity Force.

really quite worried and kinda annoyed. just random ass huge nerfs? wtf? did a rioter lose against him in a promo or something

replies.body: >* Remember *: The PBE is a testing grounds for new, tentative, and sometimes radical changes. The changes you see below may be lacking context or other accompanying changes that didn't make it in - don't freak out! These are not official notes.

Well  as it stands Azir is currently one of the strongest lane bullies in the game with long range poke, with the potential to shred the enemy backline and an ultimate which can divide a composition if used correctly. You also have the wall sticking issue and that it completely shuts out immobile champions for a whole 7 seconds in some scenarios unless you burn your flash.
but the problem there is 98% of azirs suck to much to do that

To be fair you'll still be able to make the same plays and deal sustained damage in team fights when you get to Nashor's Tooth. It looks like they've tried to remove his excess strengths like tower pushing and zone control, and I guess his early game will be a bit weaker, which should mean he will be likely be picked in more specific competitive comps rather than always.

Azir has been one of the best AP glass cannons that had everything a midlaner could hope for.
Damage, escape, low mana cost.
But i agree the W change was not needed.

Random? he's been a pick/ban in competitive for the past few months. He's too strong in pro games so they are nerfing him.

Ult nerf is warranted. The W change is a bit unnecessary I think.
hes still hard as fuck to use for beginners, i think reducing pro power is warranted, but some more QoL buffs could also help him a little
